derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: probably directly from cognizance

entry.tran: 认识到的；察知的;了解的
entry.def: If someone is cognizant of something, they are aware of it or understand it.

example.ex: We are cognizant of the problem.
example.tran: 我们意识到了这个问题。

means.word_mean: 1. (usually followed by `of') having knowledge or understanding;

sentences.sentence: "our youth are cognizant of the law"
"I am well aware of his limitations"

auth_sentence.content: Dad was conscious and cognizant, so there was never a doubt or dispute about his wishes.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可辨识的, 可以审理的
stems_affixes.word_buile: cogn知道+ize……化+able可以……的→cognizable可辨识的
cogn知道+ize……化+ant表形容词→cognizant认知的
pre预先+cogn知道+ition表名词→预先知道→预知
re再+cogn知道+ize表动词→再次知道→认出来
